quotes.quote: I am sorry you are not feeling well. I hope you have a complete and quick recovery.
Get well cards have become so humorous that if you don't get sick you're missing half the fun.
The is one consolation in being sick; and that is the possibility that you may recover to a better state than you were ever in before.
You have a cough? Go home tonight, eat a whole box of Ex-Lax - tomorrow you'll be afraid to cough.
There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
Health and good humor are to the human body like sunshine to vegetation.

Heard you're feeling not so good and need some cheering up, something that would brighten your day and says you're valued much we pray that you will feel God's love and know that He is near and that we all are thinking of you and want to show we care.
May God's love overshadow you at this time you feel unwell and know we're here thinking of you and praying for your good health.
If knowing that someone really cares, helps healing along its way then I hope you now feel better and keep improving, day by day.
Happiness is your dentist telling you it won't hurt and then having him catch his hand in the drill.
Thinking of you and praying for you for a fresh touch from the Lord, so you will get well and be strengthened again to be whole and completely restored.
Here's us hoping avidly, your recovery will be trouble free and very soon we shall see you fit as fit can be.
I am praying that you have the strength and the peace to get you though your illness.
I was starting to think that you were invincible. It's good to know that you are human after all. I'm looking forward to you getting back to your invincible self. Get well soon, superman.
When I see the moon I think of you so get well soon and you'll be good as knew.
I just wanted to write you to encourage you to stay strong and to let you know you are in my thoughts and prayers.
Okay, so today you are feeling low. But soon you will be better you know. Listen to the doctors you meet And before you know it you'll be back on your feet.
Remember what I say, your getting better by the day.
It's nice to hear you're doing well and convalescing fast, and here's a wish that your good health will last and last and last.
The treatment is really a cooperative of a trinityâ€“the patient, the doctor and the inner doctor.
This card is sent to cheer you As you're confined to bed I'm sure it'll feel all worthwhile In the happier days ahead.
Get well soon my dear, your the only one in my life may Lord be with you for the quick recovery.
If I had my way, I'd make health catching instead of disease.
We're sorry you're feeling poorly, the (factory's) empty of your laughter so get yourself well, cos we miss you, mate you're a much sought after grafter.

I heard youre feeling blue today and wanted you to know friends are all around you till the dark skies are to go when you're down and want to smile but havent found the strength just open up this little card and feel the love Ive sent.
A bad cold wouldn't be so annoying if it weren't for the advice of our friends.
If these flowers were wishes, then my wish for you is to get well soon.
For life is not to live, but to be well.
Wishing that each day brings your renewed strength, brighter times, and a healthier, happier you. Get well soon.
A slip of the foot you may soon recover, but a slip of the tongue you may never get over.
Your well-being is of great concern and your absence deeply felt. Get well soon cause no one else knows how to run the computer!
You are coping with your illness with the strength, courage, and the positive attitude that you have had for as long as I have known you.
Healing yourself is connected with healing others.
Perhaps the most important thing we ever give each other is our attention...A loving silence often has far more power to heal and to connect than the most well-intentioned words.
Only after you've accepted your situation can you begin to recover from it.
You may surprise yourself with your ability cope with and eventually accept, even the most challenging situations.
The comfort of knowing you're not alone is in itself remarkably healing.
Simple presence is the artery through which health pulses; Simple contact is the vein that restores universal healing.
Your medicine is in you, and you do not observe it. Your ailment is from yourself, and you do not register it.
True medicine only arises from the creative knowledge of the last and deepest powers of the whole universe; only he who grasps the innermost nature of man can cure him in earnest.
Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.
Much of your pain is self-chosen. It is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.
Most of the time we think we're sick, it's all in the mind.
Know that healing can be yours with time, effort, and desire. Know you can laugh again, can enjoy life again.
The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
A cheerful heart is a good medicine…
Sleep, riches, and health to be truly enjoyed must be interrupted.
Believe you can and you're halfway there.
A Jewish woman had two chickens. One got sick, so the woman made chicken soup out of the other one to help the sick one get well.
To array, a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.

I hated roses. I hated them for being so trite, so clichéd, a default, all-purpose flower that said I love you, I'm sorry, and get well soon. Give me peonies and tulips, orchids, or gardenia. Those were flowers with character.
Everything in moderation including moderation.
The best of healers is good cheer.
I reckon being ill as one of the great pleasures of life, provided one is not too ill and is not obliged to work till one is better.
Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
A shop-bought card saying Get Well Soon. Didn't seem to fit the bill. This handmade card hopes that pretty soon... ...You'll be galloping up that hill.
The most important thing in illness is never to lose heart.
I enjoy convalescence. It is the part that makes the illness worthwhile.
